event.title: was founded by Hacı I Giray, the Khan of Crimea, in 1440

data.event: The predecessor of Odessa, a small Tatar settlement, was founded by Hacı I Giray, the Khan of Crimea, in 1440 and originally named after him as "Hacıbey".

event.title: passed into the domain of the Ottoman Sultan in 1529

data.event: After a period of Lithuanian control, it passed into the domain of the Ottoman Sultan in 1529 and remained in Ottoman hands until the Ottoman Empire's defeat in the Russo-Turkish War of 1792.

event.title: Ottoman hands until the Ottoman Empire's defeat in the Russo-Turkish War of 1792

data.event: After a period of Lithuanian control, it passed into the domain of the Ottoman Sultan in 1529 and remained in Ottoman hands until the Ottoman Empire's defeat in the Russo-Turkish War of 1792.

event.title: 1794, the city of Odessa was founded

data.event: In 1794, the city of Odessa was founded by a decree of the Empress Catherine the Great.

event.title: 1 January 2000, the Quarantine Pier at Odessa Commercial Sea Port was declared

data.event: On 1 January 2000, the Quarantine Pier at Odessa Commercial Sea Port was declared a free port and free economic zone for a period of 25 years.
